comments:
Can't create a simple top down web service using WTP0.7 with websphere 6.0 app 
server. 
Steps to re-create the defect:
First start Web Sphere app server. 
1. Create a new Dynamic web project DynWebProj.
2. Ensure that target sever is used as Generic IBM WebSphere 6.0.x
3. Leave all other setting as default
4. Click Finish
5. copy 
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/jst/components/ws/M3/tutorials/resources/TopDow
nWebService/AreaService.wsdl under /DyWebProj/WebContent
6. Select AreaService.wsdl, execute "web Services->Generate Java bean skeleton"
7. Click Next, Next
8. An error message box pops up:

IWAB0234E An internal error occurred. Details: null
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
    at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.ServerCore.findServerType
(ServerCore.java:192)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.common.ServerUtils.getRuntimeTargetIdFromFactoryId
(ServerUtils.java:606)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.creation.ui.widgets.runtime.ServerRuntimeSelectionW
idgetDefaultingCommand.updateServiceEARs
(ServerRuntimeSelectionWidgetDefaultingCommand.java:732)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.creation.ui.widgets.runtime.ServerRuntimeSelectionW
idgetDefaultingCommand.execute
(ServerRuntimeSelectionWidgetDefaultingCommand.java:101)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.runCom
mand(CommandFragmentEngine.java:335)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.visitT
op(CommandFragmentEngine.java:301)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.moveFo
rwardToNextStop(CommandFragmentEngine.java:217)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.ui.widgets.SimpleCommandEngineManager$4.ru
n(SimpleCommandEngineManager.java:208)
    at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.runInCurrentThread
(ModalContext.java:346)
    at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.run(ModalContext.java:291)
    at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.run(WizardDialog.java:830)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.ui.widgets.SimpleCommandEngineManager.runF
orwardToNextStop(SimpleCommandEngineManager.java:177)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.ui.widgets.WizardPageManager.runForwardToN
extStop(WizardPageManager.java:80)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.ui.widgets.WizardPageManager.getNextPage
(WizardPageManager.java:119)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.ui.widgets.SimpleWizardPage.getNextPage
(SimpleWizardPage.java:120)

Hi Rupam,  I did an initial debug of this problem and found that since we don't 
have a runtime configuration setup for Generic IBM WebSphere 6.0.x we set the 
project name to a default value.  When we try to calculate a runtime target for 
this new project that doesn't exist the method updateServiceEARs passes a null 
to ServerCore.findServerType.

A second issue that this defect brings up is that we need to have web service 
runtime xml entries for all of the generic servers that WTP supports.

Thanks.
*** Bug 103025 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This bug will be fixed in two parts.

Part 1: The Web service wizard need some validation code that checks whether 
the currently selection server/WS run-time combination is supported. If it is 
not, then disable the Finish button and put up a banner error. Please note that 
right now, Apache Axis on generic WAS v6 is not a supported combination.

Part 2: Make Axis on generic WAS v6 a supported combination. This part of the 
fix is more involved and depends on other fixes that are still being worked on. 
Given that we are two week till WTP GM. There is a big chance that Axis on 
generic WAS v6 will not be supported in WTP 0.7. However, we are doing our best 
to try to support this combination.
I've committed the fix for part 1.
Released v20050718_1140. Leaving bug open for investigation of part II.

I suggest we do not support Generic WAS v6 server in 0.7 for the following 
reasons:

1. The wizard cannot auto create a working generic WAS v6 server because it 
requires user inputs such as cell/node/server.
2. Since the generic WAS v6 server does not use JMX, if the server is started 
outside of Eclipse, you'll get a port in use error when the wizard tries to 
publish the app.
3. At this point (2 days from RC2), I have yet to get a publish or start server 
to work. I was purely using the server tools, the Web service tools are not 
involved.

Given the concerns above, I suggest we defer this bug. If anyone disagrees, 
feel free to express your comments.

Changing to an enhancement since this bug has been dormant for several months and has not been identified as a hot bug by an adopter. At this point, we should consider support for Axis Web services by the Generic WebSphere v6 server as unsupported, and pursue the addition of support for it as an RFE.

If you have any serious concerns about this change, please advise.
